entry.title: NFT Sales Dip in June â€” Ethereum Dominates, Bitcoin Stumbles, and Bored Ape Rises
entry.summary:
In June 2023, the sales of non-fungible tokens (NFTs) experienced a decline of 4.3% compared to the previous month. The latest figures show a slide from $739.50 million recorded in May to $707.70 million in June.
June 2023 Sees a Slip in NFT Sales
Data from cryptoslam.io reveals that NFT sales in the previous month experienced a slight decrease compared to May. In June, a total of $707.70 million in sales was recorded, with $452 million attributed to Ethereum-based NFT sales. These Ethereum NFT sales constituted over 63% of the overall sales for the month, indicating a 7.89% increase from the previous monthâ€™s ETH-based NFT sales.
Among 22 different networks, Bitcoin emerges as the second-highest blockchain in terms of sales. In June, BTC-based NFT sales amounted to $110.30 million, râ€¦

entry.title: Biggest Movers: LTC Leaps to 15-Month Peak as DOGE Bull Run Continues
entry.summary:
After climbing by over 20% on Friday, litecoin extended gains to start the weekend, surging to its highest point in over a year. The move comes as momentum surrounding the tokenâ€™s listing on EDX markets continues to grow. Dogecoin also recorded a strong start to the day.
Litecoin (LTC)
Litecoin (LTC) was once again a big mover in cryptocurrency markets, as the token rallied to a multi-month high.
Following a low of $91.73 during Fridayâ€™s session, LTC/USD raced to an intraday high of $111.76 earlier today.
As a result of the rally, litecoin peaked at its strongest point since April 7 last year, when price reached a top at $116.00.
After breaking out of a ceiling at 61.00 on the relative strength index (RSI), LTC bulls took the index past yet another ceiling.
This time at the 68.00 level, with price strength peaking at 73.91 to start the weekend, which is its highest point since January.
Litecoin has since gone on to retreat from todayâ€™s high, and as of writing, is trading at $110.17.
Dogecoin (DOGE)
Another notable gainer on Saturday was dogecoin (DOGE), which climbed to a three-week high to start the weekend.
DOGE/USD jumped to a peak of $0.07079 earlier in the day, less than 24 hours after falling to $0.06264.
The move saw the worldâ€™s largest meme coin jump nearly 5% higher, hitting its highest level since June 10 in the process.
As can be seen from the chart, Saturdayâ€™s surge saw dogecoin collide with a key resistance level at $0.07000, before dropping lower.
DOGE is now trading at $0.06835, with the RSI hovering around the 56.00 mark, which is marginally above a ceiling at 55.00.
A target of $0.0750 likely remains on the agenda for bulls, however they face some challenges this weekend in order to reach this point.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Where will dogecoin peak this weekend? Let us know your thoughts in the comments.

entry.summary:
Altcoin holders who are owed money by Celsius will be able to convert their altcoins into Bitcoin and Ether as of July 1, according to a recent ruling by a New York court.Â
Celsius, a company that declared Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection in July 2022, acknowledging its substantial debt of up to $10 billion, temporarily halted withdrawals just prior to the bankruptcy filing.
Since then, Celsius has been actively collaborating with regulatory authorities to facilitate the repayment of funds to its debtors.Â
Now, with the courtâ€™s decision, individuals who are owed money can initiate the process of converting their altcoins into Bitcoin and Ether, providing them with an opportunity to retrieve their assets.
Celsius Regulatory Discussions And Altcoin Conversion

entry.title: Bitcoin, Ethereum Technical Analysis: ETH Moves Above $1,900, Hitting a 2-Month High to Start July
entry.summary:
Ethereum entered the month of July in the green, as price traded at a two-month high to start the weekend. Markets moved to rebound on Saturday, after better than expected consumer sentiment data in the United Stated spooked traders. Bitcoin also rebounded, after falling below $30,000 on Friday.
Bitcoin
After falling below the $30,000 level during Fridayâ€™s session, bitcoin (BTC) rebounded on Saturday, however sentiment was still somewhat bearish.
Following a high of $31,093.98 on Friday, BTC/USD dropped to an intraday low at $29,600.28 as the session progressed.
However, the price is now trading at $30,444.75, as bulls moved to buy the dip, pushing BTC higher to start the weekend.
As per the chart, the rebound came as the relative strength index (RSI) found a floor at the 63.00 mark.
The index is now tracking at 65.64, and seems to be heading for a resistance point around the 70.00 level.
A collision with this target will likely result in bitcoin once again moving above $31,000.
Ethereum
On the other hand, ethereum (ETH) was largely bullish to start the weekend, with price surging to a two-month high.
ETH/USD has peaked at $1,945.27 so far on Saturday, which comes a day after falling to a low at $1,831.28.
As a result of this rally, the worldâ€™s second largest cryptocurrency jumped to its strongest point since May 6.
One of the reasons for this move was a breakout, which saw the RSI move past a ceiling at the 58.00 point.
As of writing, it appears that this break may have been false, and the index is now at a reading of 58.17, giving up earlier gains.
ETH is now trading at $1,914.81.
Register your email here to get weekly price analysis updates sent to your inbox:
Will ethereum move beyond $2,000 in July? Leave your thoughts in the comments below.

The aim of this investigation is to identify cryptocurrency users who may have overlooked their tax obligations.

entry.summary:

entry.title: US Judge Orders Kraken to Release Customer Data to IRS in Cryptocurrency Tax Probe
entry.summary:
Kraken, the San Francisco-headquartered digital currency exchange, has received a court order from a U.S. judge requiring the release of customer data to the Internal Revenue Service (IRS). The court filing, submitted on Friday, states that the IRS is seeking details pertaining to accounts that registered an annual trading activity of $20,000 or higher during the years 2016 to 2020.
IRS Gains Court Order for Krakenâ€™s Customer Data in Crypto Tax Investigation
Last February, the IRS submitted a court petition to the Northern District of California, outlining its intention to thoroughly investigate Krakenâ€™s financial records and data in order to uncover cryptocurrency users who may have neglected their tax obligations. The petition specifically requested access to Krakenâ€™s â€œbooks, recordsâ€¦

entry.title: Slovakia to Lower Tax on Income From Crypto Holdings
entry.summary:
Lawmakers in Slovakia have adopted legislation that will reduce the tax burden for cryptocurrency holders in the country. Income derived from long-term investments in digital assets will also be relieved from healthcare taxes, the parliamentarians decided.
Investors in Slovakia to Pay 7% Tax on Income From Crypto Held More Than a Year
Members of the National Council of Slovakia, the countryâ€™s unicameral legislature, have approved an amendment that will reduce the taxation of cryptocurrencies, local media reported. Income from crypto assets sold more than a year after their purchase will be taxed at 7%.
Thus, the tax rate for long-term crypto holdings will be lower than the regular income tax rates. Slovaks pay personal income tax according to a progressive scale and the rate can be either 19% or 25%, for income exceeding a certain threshold.
The legislative proposal was submitted by the liberal Freedom and Solidarity party, the Democrats and the conservative Ordinary People and Independent Personalities party and backed by the We Are Family and Voice factions.
According to the updated law, gains from crypto investments will also be exempt from health taxes. Slovakiaâ€™s Ministry of Finance has estimated that the financial impact from the amendment will be around â‚¬30 million (almost $33 million) a year.
The tax exemptions come after earlier this month Slovak lawmakers sought to protect cash payments amid fears that the digital version of Europeâ€™s common fiat currency, the euro, may eventually become the only means of payment across the eurozone.
The right to pay with cash for goods and services was enshrined in the countryâ€™s constitution through an amendment proposed by the right-wing and Euroskeptic We Are Family party. The latest legal changes will also exempt from taxation crypto payments for up to â‚¬2,400 ($2,600).
Do you think other European countries will adopt a similar tax regime for crypto investments? Tell us in the comments section below.

entry.summary: The program, UNDW3, will reward engaged users with rarity-related NFT perks that the fashion brand says will increase those digital assetsâ€™ value.

entry.title: What Is a Bitcoin ETF, and Why Does Everyone from Blackrock to Fidelity Want One?
entry.summary: A Bitcoin ETF creates a simple, legally compliant way to trade the price of Bitcoin, accessible on markets that investors are already familiar with.

entry.title: Bitcoin ETF Race: Ark Amends SEC Filing to Match BlackRock
entry.summary: ARK added a surveillance-sharing agreement that appears to address potential market manipulation.

entry.title: Flirting With Algorithms: Men Are Harnessing AI to Win at the Dating Game
entry.summary: Algorithms are turning male suitors into virtual Casanovasâ€”or at least they think so.

entry.title: Humans Are More Likely to Believe Disinformation Generated By AI
entry.summary: Even before GPT-4's launch, a new study finds disinformation created with GPT-3 was harder to detect than human-made falsehoods.

entry.title: Why Laguna Games Turned Down 'Game of Thrones' for Crypto Unicorns
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin chats with Laguna Games about why the team chose to move away from an offer with WB Games to develop a Game of Thrones licensed titleâ€”and made Crypto Unicorns instead.

entry.title: Mythical Games CEO John Linden on NFL Rivals Topping 1M Downloads
entry.summary: Mythical Games just raised a $37 million Series C1 round on the back of the early success of NFL Rivals, which has already topped a million downloads in two months. Mythical CEO John Linden joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss the launch and impact of NFL Rivals.

entry.title: How Ava Labs Is Approaching Gaming on Avalanche
entry.summary: At 3XP, Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin to discuss some of the biggest Avalanche-based games on the horizon and how the company is approaching and thinking about Web3 gaming.

entry.title: Ogimi Founder David Gull on Why AI Should Be Your Meditation Coach
entry.summary: Ogimi founder David Gull speaks with Decrypt's Jason Nelson about its AI-driven meditation guides and how the technology can enable a more unique, custom-tailored meditation experience for users.

entry.title: VaynerSports Gaming VP Discusses Web3 Content Creators, Decentralized Streaming
entry.summary: Darren Glover, VP of Gaming at talent management agency VaynerSports, sat down with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss the challenges faced by Web3-centric content creators, the current state of the esports market, and how decentralized streaming platforms can challenge centralized leaders like Twitch.

entry.title: NYXL Co-Founder on the State of Esports and Crypto Gaming
entry.summary: Rohit Gupta, co-founder of esports team NYXL, chats with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo to discuss challenges faced by the esports industry and opportunities and experiments in Web3.

entry.title: What Is GameBridge? Inside Shrapnel's Gaming Innovation
entry.summary: Marc Mercuri, Head of Platform for Web3 shooter Shrapnel, speaks with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at the 3XP expo about GameBridge, a feature that simplifies blockchain item composability and interoperability.

entry.title: Gods Unchained Executive Producer Discusses Epic Games Store Move
entry.summary: Daniel Paez, Executive Producer on Immutable X-based card-battler Gods Unchained, discusses the long-running NFT game's launch on the Epic Games Store and the opportunity it provides.

entry.title: 'Play-to-Earn Is Not Dead. It Will Never Die' Says Words with Friends Creator Paul Bettner
entry.summary: Words With Friends and Wildcard Creator Paul Bettner tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his perspective on Axie Infinity and Web3 games.

entry.title: Cross the Ages Game Review: A Tough But Rewarding Card Battler
entry.summary: Cross the Ages is a digital collectible card game that challenges players to duel online opponentsâ€”and you can even mint your cards as tradable NFTs. It's complex and difficult to grasp at first, but this mobile-first game has some serious strategic upside. GG contributor Ryan Gladwin puts Cross the Ages through its paces.

entry.title: "AI Is Game-Changing But Needs Fact-Checking": AlchemyAI Project Lead
entry.summary: In this interview, Decrypt's Jason Nelson chats with Alchemy product manager and AlchemyAI project lead Elan Halpern on blockchain analysis using ChatGPT, what AI means for better user experience, and the need to fact-check AI. Halpern also gives a demo of the new AlchemyAI ChatGPT plugin.

entry.title: Fractal Is Like an Arcade, Says Twitch Co-Founder Justin Kan
entry.summary: Justin Kan was a co-founder of Twitch and now works on Fractal, a Web3 gaming startup. Kan tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about his new company and what he's up to.

entry.title: Are NFTs the Next SEC Target?
entry.summary: Decrypt's Kate Irwin discusses the current regulatory climate in the U.S. with Gala Games' President of Blockchain Jason Brink.

entry.title: Collab.Land Co-Founder Said There Was No â€˜Aha Momentâ€™ When Launching DAO Toolkit
entry.summary: CCO and co-founder of Collab.Land Anjali Young explained at this yearâ€™s NFC Lisbon the origins of the crypto community tool kit, which industry niches are turning to its suite of products, and whatâ€™s next for the project since its token distribution event last February.

entry.title: Buying a Slice of H.R. Giger's 'Alien' Is Fine Art, Not Memorabilia: Particle CEO
entry.summary: With H.R. Giger's original "Alien" statue on full display at this year's NFC Lisbon, Particle CEO Harold Eytan told Decrypt that owning an NFT-ified slice of the piece isn't just for fans of the iconic creature and movie series but also for fine art collectors. Interested in owning a piece? Be prepared to cough up half an ETH for one of the 500 tranches of the digitized sculpture.

entry.title: Community Co-Creation 'Is a Big Step for Fashion Brands' Entering the Metaverse: BNV Founder and CEO
entry.summary: The founder and CEO of metaverse fashion platform BNV Richard Hobbs said big brands are still nervous to let fans and community members customize their favorite garments. Still, he believes that as long as you can meet a firm's commercial bottom lines while stirring engagement, there's nothing to lose.

entry.title: Standard Crypto VC Co-Founder on NFTs and Their Stigma in Gaming
entry.summary: Alok Vasudev is a co-founder of venture capital firm Standard Crypto. In an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, he shares his thoughts on NFT marketing, NFT utility in gaming, and the stigma that pervades the industry.

entry.title: Ava Labs Announces Avalanche Arcad3 for Game Developers at 3XP
entry.summary: Ava Labs Head of Gaming Ed Chang shares news with Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the crypto firm's latest push to help traditional game developers break into blockchain gaming.
